summary: Email chain between FBI agents, a contractor, and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding the coordination of financial document subpoenas and evidence transfer for the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. It includes planning a meeting and arranging for discs of financial data to be delivered.

Both are FBI agents copied on the same emails, coordinating on the financial investigation of Epstein.

events.title: Subpoenas issued to financial institutions
events.description: Subpoenas were issued to Deutsche Bank and American Express for financial documents related to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Coordination for evidence transfer
events.description: Emails coordinate the burning of financial document folders to a disc and planning for its delivery to law enforcement.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Email confirmation of subpoenas
events.description: An email confirms the attachment of subpoenas to Deutsche Bank and American Express.

keyFacts: Subpoenas were issued to Deutsche Bank and American Express on July 11, 2019, for financial documents related to Jeffrey Epstein.
An Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York directed a contractor to burn specific folders of financial data to a disc for law enforcement.
FBI agents and a prosecutor were actively coordinating evidence transfer and planning a meeting to discuss the investigation strategy in July 2019.
The email chain demonstrates active inter-agency collaboration (FBI, U.S. Attorney's Office, contractors) in the financial investigation of Epstein.
The document references the use of forensic accounting assistance within the FBI squad for the Epstein investigation.
